meanings.definition: To agree or affirm with a positive response.
meanings.sent1: She was yessing enthusiastically to the idea of going to the park.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys yessing whenever his friends suggest a movie night.
meanings.sent3: The dog was yessing happily when offered a treat.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden seemed to be yessing in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The students were yessing in unison during the school assembly.

meanings.definition: The act of saying yes or expressing agreement.
meanings.sent1: His constant yessing in meetings made him well-liked by his colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The audience responded with loud yessing to the speaker's proposal.
meanings.sent3: The yessing from the crowd was music to the performer's ears.
meanings.sent4: The waves crashing against the shore sounded like a chorus of yessing.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with the joyful yessing of children playing games.

meanings.definition: The act of nodding or indicating approval.
meanings.sent1: She showed her yessing by nodding vigorously at the suggestion.
meanings.sent2: The yessing of the audience encouraged the speaker to continue.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a slow yessing when offered a cozy spot by the fireplace.
meanings.sent4: The trees seemed to be yessing in agreement as their leaves rustled in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The yessing of the group members signaled their readiness to proceed with the project.
